1.<cs_pchero>は ドガに|災いの鉄杭と グレイトフルロッドを|渡した！: <cs_pchero> gave Doga the Stake of Woe and|the Grateful Rod!

2.ドガは 災いの鉄杭と|グレイトフルロッドを 組み合わせて|たかえだツルハシを 作: Doga combined the Stake of Woe and the|Grateful Rod to create the Orata Pickaxe!

3.ドガは たかえだツルハシの先端を|天井へ向けて スルスルと伸ばしていった。: Doga slid the tip of his pickaxe toward the|ceiling.

4.ドガは たかえだツルハシで|頭上の一点を 迷いのない一撃で 突いた！: Doga pokes a point above his head with a|stray blow with a tall pickaxe!

5.すると 崩れた天井から ひと粒の|美しい宝石が こぼれ落ちてきた……。: Then a beautiful jewel fell from the collapsed|ceiling.

7.「我らは 紅衣の悪夢団。| ダークドレアム様の降臨を 望む者なり。: Oi' mates. We're da' Redcoats of Nightmares.|We wish for the return o' the mighty|Nokturnus.

8.「刻印を刻まれし 供物よ。| 我らが主のために その命を捧げよ！: Oh offerings engraved with da' mark of our|lord! Give yer' lives for our lord!

9.「貴様っ……まだ ジャマをする気かぁっ！！: You... you're still trying to get in my way!

10.<cs_pchero>は ドガに 刻印のこと|そして 紅衣の悪夢団のことを 説明: <cs_pchero> explained to Doga about the|Mark and the Red-clad Nightmare Gang.

11.「やあ <pc> キミか。| 古代呪文シャナクを 会得するには| もう少し 時間: Hey <pc>, it's you. It's going to|take me a little longer to learn the ancient|spell Shanach.

14.「こっ これは……？| 凝縮された魔力の かたまりなのか！？| すさまじいチカラ: Is this...? Is this a cluster of condensed|magic? I can feel its tremendous power!

15.「なんてことだ……。<pc>の他にも| 刻印を刻まれてしまった者が いたなんて。: My God... I can't believe there were others|besides <pc> who got the imprint.

16.「なるほど。それで ボクの所へ来たのか……。: I see. So that's why you came to me.

17.「いいだろう。ボクのシャナクの呪文で| あなたの刻印を 必ず 消し去ってみせよう: Fine. I'll make sure my Shanach spell will|erase your mark!

19.「我が言葉を聞き 鎮まりたまえ。| 破邪の光にて 消え去りたまえ……。: Hear my words and be appeased. By the light of|the evil, be extinguished...

21.「よう。ひさしぶり！| あんたに 伝えたいことがあってよ。| どうしても会いたく: Hey, how are you? Long time no see! I wanted|to tell you something. I really wanted to see|you.

22.「あんた 覚えてるかな？| オイラが あんたに託した 気持ち。| 落盤事故で死ん: I wonder if you remember... The way I felt|when I entrusted you with my life. I was|killed in a rock fall. I'll never forget it.

23.「オイラには 一緒に育った 兄貴がいた。| 地面を掘るのが 大好きな オイラたち: I had an older brother who I grew up with. We|loved digging in the ground, and our dream was|to one day dig up a legendary treasure.

24.「あんたには オイラに代わって 兄貴に会って| 伝説のお宝探しに 協力してほしか: I wanted you to meet my brother and help him|find the legendary treasure on behalf of I.|His name is Doga.

25.「オイラの願いを かなえてくれて……| 兄貴とお宝を探してくれて ありがとう！|: Thank you for granting my wish... and finding|the treasure with my brother! That's all I|needed to hear.

26.「これからは お前が掘りたかった分の穴も| 全部まとめて 俺が掘ってやるって……: You told me that from now on I would dig all|the holes you wanted to dig... didn't you?

27.「すまねえ 兄貴。ありがてえ ありがてえ……。| これでもう 思い残すことは な: Sorry, bro. Thank you, thank you... now I have|nothing left to regret.

28.「あんたには ずいぶん 世話になったな。| これからは オイラのことは 気にせず: You have been a great help to me. From now on,|I hope you will go your own way without|worrying about I.

29.「これは オイラからのお礼だ。| いつか きっと 何かの役に立つはずだから| 取: This is a thank-you from I. I'm sure it will|come in handy someday, so please keep it.

31.「それにしても さすがは兄貴だ。| せっかく手に入れた お宝を| あんなにも あ: Even so, as expected of my brother. I can't|believe you let go of the treasure you|received so easily.

32.「きっと 兄貴は さらなるロマンを目指して| これからも 夢中で突き進んでいくん: I'm sure my brother will continue to go on|with his dreams, aiming for even more romance.|Chasing big, big dreams!

33.「この先 どこかで 兄貴に出会ったら| またチカラを 貸してやってくれよな。|: If you run into my brother somewhere down the|road, lend him your help again, will you? Well|then, I'd better get going.

34.「達者でな エテーネの村の <pc>。| オイラは 兄貴に負けねえよう| あの世: Good luck, <pc> of Ethene Village.|I'm sure I'll be digging holes in the|afterlife to keep up with you!

35.「いやあ ひさしぶり！| あんたに 伝えたいことがあってね。| どうしても会いた: Well, it's been a while! I wanted to tell you|something. I really wanted to meet you, so I|came here.

36.「あんた 覚えてるかな？| あたしが あんたに託した 気持ち。| 落盤事故で死ん: I wonder if you remember... The feelings I|entrusted to you. I was killed in a cave-in|accident, and I still have a lot of regret.

37.「あたしには 一緒に育った 兄ちゃんがいた。| 地面を掘るのが 大好きな あたし: I had a brother who I grew up with. We loved|digging in the ground, and our dream was to|one day dig up a legendary treasure.

38.「あんたには あたしに代わり 兄ちゃんに会って| 伝説のお宝探しに 協力してほし: I wanted you to meet my brother on my behalf|and help him find the legendary treasure. My|brother's name is... Doga.

39.「あたしの願いを かなえてくれて……| 兄ちゃんとお宝を探してくれて ありがとう: Thank you for granting my wish and finding the|treasure with my brother! That's all I needed|to hear.

40.「これからは お前が掘りたかった分の穴も| 全部まとめて 俺が掘ってやるって……: You told me that from now on I would dig all|the holes you wanted to dig, right?

41.「ごめんよ 兄ちゃん。ホントに ありがとう。| これでもう 思い残すことは なん: I'm sorry, bro. Thank you so much. I have|nothing more to regret.

42.「あんたには ずいぶん 世話になったね。| これからは あたしのことは 気にせず: You have been a great help to me. From now on,|I want you to go your own way without worrying|about me.

43.「これは あたしからのお礼だよ。| いつか きっと 何かの役に立つはずだから|: This is a thank you from me. I'm sure it will|be useful for something someday, so please|keep it.

45.「それにしても さすがは兄ちゃん。| せっかく手に入れた お宝を| あんなにも: But still, as expected of my brother. I can't|believe you let go of the treasure you|received so easily.

46.「きっと 兄ちゃんは さらなるロマンを目指して| これからも 夢中で突き進んでい: I am sure that you will continue to pursue|your dreams of romance. Chasing big, big|dreams!

47.「この先 どこかで 兄ちゃんに出会ったら| またチカラを 貸してあげてねぇ。|: If you meet my brother anywhere down the road,|please lend him your strength again. Well|then, I'd better get going.

48.「達者でね エテーネの村の <pc>。| あたしは 兄ちゃんに負けないよう| あ: He is a master, <pc> of Ethene|Village. I think I'll be digging holes in the|afterlife to keep up with you!

50.「…………？| なんだ お前は…………。: What the? Who are you, partner?

51.「俺はドワーフいちの 穴掘り師| トレジャーハンターのドガ。| お前の名は？: Howdy partner, name's Doga. Treasure hunter|and one the best dwarf diggers. What's your|name?

52.「ほう <pc>……か。なるほどな。| お前は ここへ宝探しにきた……| ってワ: Oh, <pc>.... I see. You don't seem to|be here on a treasure hunt, are ya'?

53.「……なに？| 最近 悪夢を見ていないか だと？| ああ……もちろん 見てるさ。: Wha? Ya' haven't been having nightmares|lately? Well, partner, of course I'm having|nightmares.

54.「穴掘りという名の 終わりなき悪夢をな……。: It's a never-ending nightmare of digging|holes...

55.<if_woman>「思い起こせば 少年時代……。| ガキの時分から 地面を掘る: <if_woman>I remember as a boy... from the time|I was a kid, I loved digging in the ground. My|sister and I used to run around like crazy.<else>I remember as a boy... from the time I|was a kid, I loved digging in the ground. I|used to run around with my little brother.<endif>

56.「そしていつしか 当たり前のように| 伝説のお宝を 掘り当てるという| 大きな夢: And as I took it for granted, I had a big|dream in my heart to dig up the legendary|treasure...

57.「伝説のお宝を 掘り当てるまでは| 永遠に覚めない夢……。| ああ……まさに悪夢: A dream you'll never wake up from until ya'|dig up the legendary treasure... Ah... a|nightmare indeed.

58.「この 穴掘りという 最高のロマンは……な。: The greatest romance of all is digging holes.

59.「ここ ナシームの洞くつの 忘れられた広間には| 伝説のお宝 ナシームの魔眼が: Here, in the Forgotten Hall of Naseem's Cave,|lies the legendary treasure of Naseem's Evil|Eye. I came here to dig it out.

60.「しかし……お宝の場所は 突き止めたものの| ワケあって 簡単には 掘ることがで: But... although I've located the treasure, for|some reason, I can't dig it out easily. Fate|has given me a test, I guess...

61.「ナシームの魔眼を 掘り出すためには| この洞くつで 材料を調達し| とある 特: In order to dig out Naseem's Evil Eye, one|must go to this cave to procure materials and|make a special tool.

62.「<%sEV_QUE_NAME0>から 災いの鉄杭を| <%sEV_QUE_NA:
If we get the Stake of Woe from|<%sEV_QUE_NAME0> and the Grateful Rod from|<%sEV_QUE_NAME1> we should be able to make|
|that tool.

63.「ここで出会ったのも 何かの縁だろう。| ふたつの材料を手に入れて この先の|:
It must be some kind of a coincidence that we|met here. Would you be willing to receive the|two materials and come to the Forgotten Hall|
|down the road?

64.「ああ……見せてやるぜ？| 最高の悪夢ってヤツを な。: Yeah... let me show you something, huh? I'll|show you my greatest nightmare.

65.「<cs_pchero>か。| 災いの鉄杭と グレイトフルロッドを| 手に入れた: <cs_pchero>. Looks like you received the|Stake of Woe and the Grateful Rod.

66.「あの亡者どもには 俺も 手を焼いていた。| それを あっさり倒してしまうとは…: I had a hard time with those walkers. You're|going to make a good hole digger if you can|beat them so easily.

67.「さあ ふたつのアイテムを 渡してくれ。| 約束通り 最高の悪夢を 見せてやるぜ: Now, give me the two items. As promised, I'll|give you the best nightmare of your life.<yesno><close>

68.「宝を目の前にして おのれの欲望を制する か。| ……フッ。見上げたヤツだ。|:
Will you conquer your own desires in front of|the treasure? He's a guy who looks up to me.|He's a guy who looks up to you. I don't|
|dislike his stoic spirit, but...

69.「俺たちが 掘り出そうとしている| お宝……ナシームの魔眼。| こいつに秘められ: The treasure we are trying to dig out is|Naseem's Evil Eye. Do you know the legend|behind it?

70.「アラハギーロ王国に その名をとどろかせた| いにしえの大魔法使い ナシーム。|: Naseem, the great mage of ancient times who|made his name famous in the Kingdom of|Arahagiro. He had a secret.

71.「それは 自分の額に埋め込んだ 宝石。| 莫大な魔力の込められた 美しい第三の目:
It was a jewel embedded in his forehead. With|a beautiful third eye imbued with enormous|magical power, he was able to manipulate|
|powerful magic at will.

72.「ある日 ナシームは 自分のアジトの洞くつから| 外に出ようと 古代呪文ルーラを: One day, Naseem cast the ancient spell Zoom to|get out of the cave of his hideaway. And the|rest... you know what?

73.「勢いよく 飛び上がったナシームは| 洞くつの天井で 強く頭をぶつけた！| その:
Naseem jumped up with such force that he hit|his head hard on the ceiling of the cave! The|impact dislodged the jewel on his forehead and|
|buried it in the ceiling...

74.「そのまま地面に たたきつけられたナシームは| 薄れゆく意識の中 最期の呪文を唱:
Naseem, who had to be slammed to the ground,|cast his last spell in his fading|consciousness and magically hid the jewel|
|buried in the ceiling.

75.「わが秘宝は 誰にも渡さぬ……と つぶやいて。: "I will not give my treasures to anyone...",|he mumbled.

76.「消えたナシームの魔眼……| 今まで何度となく 夢見る男たちが挑戦したが| それ: The missing Naseem's Evil Eye... has been|sought out many times by treasure hunters,|but no one has dug it out yet.

77.「だが……俺なら できる。| コイツを手にした| この 穴掘り師 ドガになら……: But I can do it. You can count on Doga the|cave digger.

78.「……見切ったッ！| そこだぁぁぁぁッ！！: Yee-haw! I see it! There it is!!

79.「やったな <cs_pchero>！| ああ ついに……| ついに 伝説のお宝を: We did it! At last... at last... we have|received our legendary treasure!

82.「やれやれ……あやうく お宝を掘り出した穴を| 自分の命で 埋め合わせるところだ: Good grief... you almost made up for the hole|you dug out of the treasure with your own|life. The trials of fate are relentless.

83.「しかし この胸の刻印は いったいなんだ？| それに さっきの赤マントの連中は|: But what in the world is this imprint on my|chest? And who the hell were those people in|red cloaks earlier...?

84.「この刻印は ダークドレアムってのを| 降臨させるための 供物の証だったのか。: So this mark was a sign of an offering to|bring back Nokturnus.

85.「……なるほどな。| しかし 刻印を消すなんてこと できるのか？| 相当に強力な: I see. But is it possible to remove the mark?|It seems to be a very powerful curse.

86.「……ふむ。古代呪文シャナクか。| そして その呪文を ふたたび唱えるには| 莫: ...Hmmm. The ancient spell Shanak. And it|takes a lot of magic power to cast that spell|again.

87.「だが それだけの魔力を | どうやって 調達すればいいんだ……？: But how am I supposed to procure that much|magic?

88.「そうか <cs_pchero>！| その ナシームの魔眼だ！: Oh yeah <cs_pchero>! Its Naseem's Evil Eye!

89.「莫大な魔力を宿した こいつを使えば| 古代呪文も 発動できるかもしれない。|: With the enormous amount of magic power in|it, it might be able to activate ancient|spells. It's worth a try, isn't it?

90.「アサナギとやらは セレドの町の| ガケ沿いの集会所に いるんだな。| よし 行: So, Asanagi is at the Cliffside Meeting|Place in the Town of Celed. Okay, let's go|<cs_pchero>!

91.「……ん？ せっかく手に入れた お宝を| そんな簡単に 手放してもいいのか……だ: Hmm? You don't think it's right to give up a|treasure so easily, do you?

92.「ああ……構わないさ。| 掘り出してしまった後の 宝なんて| もう 宝じゃない。: Oh...it doesn't matter. Treasure is no longer|treasure after it's been dug out.

93.「宝は 埋まっているからこそ 宝なんだ。| 俺は 伝説のお宝という名のロマンを|: Treasure is treasure because it's buried. I,|for one, want to dig up that legendary|treasure of romance called...

95.「俺は トレジャーハンターの ドガ。| ドワーフいちの 穴掘り師さ。| お前に: Howdy partner, name's Doga. Treasure hunter|and one the best dwarf diggers. I need a|favor.

96.「さあ <pc>。| 例のものを 渡してやってくれ。: Come on <pc>. Give him the eye.

97.「伝説のお宝 ナシームの魔眼。| こいつの魔力を使って 古代呪文を唱え| 俺の: The legendary treasure, Naseem's Evil Eye. I|want you to use its magic to cast an ancient|spell to erase the mark on my chest.

98.「刻印は 無事に浄化されたようだな。| 礼を言うぜ アサナギ。: The Mark seems to have been successfully|purified. I thank you, Asanagi.

99.「<pc>。お前には 心から感謝している。| 数々の危機から 俺を救ってくれたな: <pc>. I am truly grateful to you. You|saved me from many dangers. Thank you so much.

100.「さて……ここいらで 俺は 旅立つとするか。| 新たなロマンに 出会うための旅へ:
Well...I guess I'll be leaving now. A journey|to meet new romance. As long as there are|treasures in this world, I will continue to|
|dream.

101.「……<pc>。俺は| 共に 穴を掘った仲間を 忘れない。| 共に 同じ夢を見た:
.... I will never forget my|companions who dug holes with me. I will never|forget the companion who shared the same dream|
|with me.

102.<if_woman>「ああ……全部わかっていたよ。| 確かに お前の身体は 俺の:
Oh...I knew all that. Surely, your|body belongs to my sister. Yeah...I knew|it all. Surely, your body belongs to my|
|brother.

103.「しかし 心は…… その魂は| すっかり 別人のものだってことに……な。: But the heart, the soul belongs to someone|else.

104.「ヘンな所で 律儀な あいつのことだ。| 俺に合わせる顔がないとか 思ってるかも: He's a very conscientious guy in a weird way.|He might be thinking that he has no face to|show to me. But...

105.「心配するな！| これからは お前が掘りたかった分の穴も| 全部まとめて 俺が掘: Don't worry! From now on, I'll dig all the|holes you wanted to dig.

106.「もしも あいつに会うことがあったら| そう 伝えておいてくれ。: If you ever see him, tell him that.

...a funny joke, but it's not funny now. Hey,|would you be willing to receive the two|ingredients and come down to the Forgotten|
|Hall down the road?

108.「よし……やろう！ 俺たち ふたりでなら| この運命の試練も 乗り越えられるさ。: Okay... let's do it! I'm sure we can get|through this ordeal together. I'll go ahead|and get ready.

109.<if_woman>「だって 俺たちは……| ふたりきりの 兄妹じゃないか。<e: <if_woman>Because we're... just the two of us,|brother and sister. <else>Because we are...|just two siblings. <endif>
